On the contrary, it concerns the development of KSP (albeit on another platform) and it's definitely the most noteworthy bit of news this week ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'm still amazed and saddened that the community does this every time\* they don't get devnotes.

Good or bad, it should be in news then.

 Covering up the fact that no development to speak of happened this week with this is to be fair and honest a teeny bit insulting. Sorry but that's just how I feel about it.

Well Squad, it seems we mostly respectfully disagree with you on this one. 

I can see the benefits of this deal, with the whole "accelerated transition to U5" that seems to be absolutely necesarry for PS4 release, and those benefits spilling back to core PC project.

Now, on the other hand, I also absolutely am worried as much as anyone else that (outside of the previous ego issues) the game really might slip down the slippery slope and become something LESS than it is already. 

What if:

Squad can push the game to even more popularity, without reducing it's quality in the process, until in the end the game (hold my breath, cross my fingers, knock on wood, rabbit's foot...) becomes a world wide phenomenon, to actually become more interresting that talking about popular tv shows that dumb people down?

I guess I'm a bit of an idealist here..

> 
> This isn't a dev note, particularly if we are to believe that this port won't take up any dev time. It's news. Move it to Announcements.

Being this aggressive probably isn't needed...

Although i agree with you, i don't understand why this didn't go in the announcements thread...

So finally what is to be expected in 1.0.3 ? Is it still only a fix ? Or is Unity 5 being packed into it and that's why it's taking so long ?

@Kasper : i think the reason why everyone is afraid of the PS4 port is because of what happened to other games that were poeted on console, it didn't really go well...

> 
> Well Squad, it seems we mostly respectfully disagree with you on this one. 
> I can see the benefits of this deal, with the whole "accelerated transition to U5" that seems to be absolutely necesarry for PS4 release, and those benefits spilling back to core PC project.

> 
> I guess I'm a bit of an idealist here..

I share your idealism, though I'm sure there is a place for both challenging games such as Kerbal Space Program and care-free entertainment alike. To illustrate this: I play KSP, listen to classical music and jazz, and last night I was playing Farming Simulator.

> 
> So finally what is to be expected in 1.0.3 ? Is it still only a fix ? Or is Unity 5 being packed into it and that's why it's taking so long ?

1.0.3 will be a bugfix / rebalance release. We're taking our time with it to gather feedback from our experimental testing team who (and this is going to sound brown-nosy) are doing an excellent job.

> 
> @Kasper : i think the reason why everyone is afraid of the PS4 port is because of what happened to other games that were poeted on console, it didn't really go well...
> I understand that, definitely. But projecting the failures of completely unrelated projects onto KSP, thus creating a one-sided picture and then stating that it will be the inevitable end of the prject won't help. There are plenty of good stories, too.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-17T14:48:22Z" title="06/17/2015 02:48  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 17, 2015</time> by KasperVld**
  
answering more questions

The thing is, most people play KSP because they like space (and Jeb). Most people that play PS4 like first person shooter games. They're probably not going to purchase a slightly nerdy (but fun) game like this one. That's what PC people like.

>

Squad will be helping them every step of the way. The game is very complex now and making it work on the PS4 architecture will be tough. I bet it's more than a year away. 
> And how do you know Flying Tiger will be helping Squad move to Unity 5? I haven't seen anything saying that. If you have a link, provide it please.

[Check the Faq Maxmaps posted here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/344-Kerbal-Space-Program-is-coming-to-PlayStation-4-What-does-that-mean-for-you). You are right that it may take a while to do the port. 

> 
> During its PlayStation Latin America event tonight at the Electronic Entertainment Expo, Sony revealed that Kerbal Space Program will come to the PlayStation 4 in **2016**.

KSP has been in development for 3-4 years, the developers understand their code. I imagine many collaboration questions can be answered via email. Squad has already complimented them for their help with U5 thus far. The benefit of additional income from this port could, if wisely reinvested in development, help KSP on PC see new and interesting features sooner, rather than later.
